Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: Folks,  all details about our coming ICO are out. Please read our Medium blog post to know everything.  We hope to see you in our Slack team and answer your questions about ICO. A technical FAQ will be out soon too.  Stay tuned for more articles and video about Aventus ticketing solution

Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: It will be fully decentralised in fact. At first, we will be aiding in the setting up of system parameters (e.g. fee values and time periods), but we aim to make it fully decentralised by mid 2018.  The idea of the full decentralisation is that we want to create a global standard for ticketing exchange that anyone can plug into and use, that isn't controlled by any one entity. It solves the problems of unregulated touting, counterfeit tickets, lack of oversight, and finally artists not reaching a wider audience. By making it fully decentralised and creating a pool of events on the protocol that anyone can add to and anyone can sell tickets for and gain commissions, we allow anyone to become a promoter thereby letting artists reach a wider audience .

Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: There is no public presale. It will be limited to strategic partners, but public ICO will be July 19! Please see the blog post here: https://blog.aventus.io/aventus-a-blockchain-based-event-ticketing-solution-is-pleased-to-announce-details-about-its-9a8168ae3724.

Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: Hi talkingdreams,  We are not advertising the presale to any investors. This is an allocation reserved for some of our clients, corporate partners, and strategic alliances who were interested in investing in us. Since they believed in us by working with us at such an early stage, we allowed them to purchase tokens at a discounted rate. If we have some allocation left over, we are considering opening it up to the public for contributions but we are probably going to just shift the remaining allocation to the public sale.

Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: Hi, thank you for your reply. We have 2 main industries we are targeting, which are very affected by fraud and touting issues.  (1) Sports - if you look at boxing matches and stuff like this, tickets start at Â£500 and then end up on secondary markets at Â£20k 5 mins later! We can fix this problem. We are looking at English football teams now and hoping to apply our solution there.  (2) Music - look at Adele tickets, which went to Â£9k last year after being released for Â£30! She was really upset about this. We plan to tackle the music industry with this.  The solution really applies to any ticketing, but as I said mainly where touting is an issue. We could do airline tickets or bus tickets, as it would make it a bit more efficient, but its not as important there.  The other thing - what we plan to do with the protocol and token is to create a global open pool of events that anyone can sell tickets for and gain commissions for doing so. So, now social influencers, community chat apps, promoters, other ticketing apps, etc and basically anyone can build a frontend and sell tickets to curated events from that list to their communities. So now, events can reach a wider audience and sell more tickets.

Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: Fair enough. Is this something you would like to see on the ANN, or is looking through the website/whitepaper good enough?  We have not released any crowdsale details yet..that is coming very soon. Until now, we had just publicly announced the project but were still going through a couple of iterations making it better based on feedback from the community.

Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: We have not announced any crowdsale details yet but those are coming very soon, this week.  We will have an alpha for you to play around with this week, it will be on a public test net.  As for the product, we have gone through a few iterations of the blockchain components and we should be good to go with that in a couple of months. The server components, which will make integration with existing ticketing companies easy, still need to be fully developed.  We are going to be targeting both existing businesses and new startups. Existing ticketing companies have massive amounts of technical debt. We are going to offer them a turnkey solution where all they have to do is build a frontend and focus on getting customers - we will handle all of the backend. We will also be targeting new startups, that will be able to build apps/dapps on top of the Aventus protocol so that they can sell tickets on behalf of events - think, community apps (like Reddit specific to e.g. people who like Star Wars), or social media influencers - who can make money off of promoting tickets in their communities.

Author: aventus
Title: [ANN] Aventus - Event Ticketing Antifraud Solution
Body: Hey, did you manage to read the white paper? It is a proof of stake coin. If you see in the ANN post, the coin is mainly used for stake weighted voting that ensures: (a) legitimate events on the protocol that apps on top can choose from; (b) legitimate apps on top of the protocol, so end users don't get scammed from fake apps claiming to be Aventus secure; and (c) voting on system parameters that determine how the protocol functions. The coin is also used for stake-weighted matching of buyers and sellers in the secondary market, since to ensure the protection and regulation of touting we need to ensure anonymous buying and selling of tickets (so no off-chain transactions can occur).

Please no need to post here + send me a PM + message in Slack. That's too many channels.  IMPORTANT: all set up for the bounty campaign will be done in dedicated channels in our Slack team.
